scicoms

Class Robot

  • java.lang.Object
    • scicoms.Robot

  • public class Robot
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstracts away all tasks related to controlling and communicating with the SciWorkflow robot. Provides methods for sending movement commands to a remote ControlServer instance. Automatically retrieves and maintains sensor information.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Aaron Pabst

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Robot(java.lang.String addr, int portno, int updateInterval, int histSize)
      Initilizes a connection to the science workflow robot at addr:portno

    • Constructor Detail

      • Robot

        public Robot(java.lang.String addr,
             int portno,
             int updateInterval,
             int histSize)
        Initilizes a connection to the science workflow robot at addr:portno
        Parameters:
        addr - - The ip address of the robot
        portno - - The port number of the control service
        updateInterval - - The amount of time to wait between sensor updates
        histSize - - The number of sensor samples to maintain

    • Method Detail

      • drive

        public void drive(int theta,
                  int speed)
        Sends a drive command to the robot with parameters theta and speed
        Parameters:
        theta - The direction to insert into the command
        speed - The speed to insert into the command

      • pan

        public void pan(int x,
                int y)
        Sends a pan command to the robot with parameters x any y
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal position to move the camera to
        y - The vertical position to move the camera to

      • rcvPending

        public boolean rcvPending()
        Returns:
        True if there is a pending response handler

      • getSensorSnapshot

        public Sensor[] getSensorSnapshot()
        Produces a copy of the sensor list and current history as it exists when this method is called. This copy is not updated after it's returned to the user and must be called again to obtain an up to date copy.
        Returns:
        A sensor array containing all the sensors as they exist at this moment in time

      • getIdMapping

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getIdMapping()
        Produces a map of sensor names to sensor ids
        Returns:
        A HashMap mapping names to id numbers

      • getMostRecent

        public SensorSample getMostRecent(int id)

      • kill

        public void kill()
